page.title: 06THE BREWERY AT DEVIZES.
page.content: The Northgate Brewery in Devizes was built in 1885 by Henry Alfred Wadworth and has an impressive Victorian facade.The Wadworth Company now distribute their beers as far afield as Wales,The Midlands,London and the South West. Wadworth's magnificent shire horses are a familiar sight delivering their daily consignment of traditional beer to the twenty or so pubs within a two and a half mile radius of the Brewery. However for supplies further afield,a fleet of modern lorries,which are still referred to as drays,are used. Wadworth's have always been closely involved with the community and the Company sponsors a wide range of events,many of which involve well known personalities.Some of Wadworth's better known brews are Farmers Glory, introduced in 1984,and the older 6X.
